title: Sisters of Death 1976 | Mystery, Thriller | Claudia Jennings, Cheri Howell | Full Movie

sources.title: Sisters of Death 1976 | Mystery, Thriller | Claudia Jennings, Cheri Howell | Full Movie
sources.description:
During an all-girl secret society initiation, one of the new members is killed playing Russian Roulette. Many years later the survivors are invited for a reunion to a lavish estate, which turns out to be owned by the crazed father of the girl who died.

Director: Joe Mazzuca
Writers: Peter Arnold, Elwyn Richards  

Main cast:
Arthur Franz – Edmond Clybourn
Claudia Jennings – Judy Peake
Sherry Boucher – Diana Holcomb
Paul Carr – Mark Roberson
Joe E. Tata – Joe
Cheri Howell – Sylvia Woodworth
Sherry Alberoni – Frances "Francie" Tomalillo
Elizabeth Bergen – Liz Clybourn

Genres: Classics, Mystery, Thriller 
Release date: April 18, 1976 (USA)
Filming location: San Luis Obispo County, California


00:00 Full Movie with subtitles
00:30 Sisters Judy and Liz undergo a tense initiation into the secret society, setting the stage for lifelong vows and hidden dangers.
09:10 Penny senses doom as the sisters receive mysterious invitations to a reunion, foreshadowing the darkness to come.
21:19 Joe and Mark deliver the women to a remote hacienda, where the group realizes they are isolated and something is amiss.
37:27 Mr. Clybourn confronts the sisters, accusing one of them of murdering his daughter Elizabeth during their initiation.
49:19 The group discovers the electrified fence and the first shocking death, confirming they are trapped with a killer.
1:03:02 Tensions rise as the sisters and their companions attempt escape plans, but paranoia and fear escalate with each failed attempt.
1:13:36 Judy and the survivors uncover the true power source of the deadly fence, leading to a desperate final confrontation.
1:19:04 Sylvia reveals her guilt and the tragic truth behind Elizabeth’s death, culminating in a deadly showdown and the survivors’ escape.


The PG rating in 1976 reflects its tame violence by modern standards.

@CultCinemaClassics
